Key Match Events: Bohm grounded into fielder's choice to third, Harper scored on fielding error by third baseman Vientos, Castellanos safe at third on error.
Lindor homered to center (398 feet), Marte scored, Taylor scored and Alvarez scored.
Post-Match Reflections: Francisco Lindor hit a grand slam in the sixth inning, his latest clutch swing in a storybook season full of them, and the New York Mets won the game 4-1 over the Phillies in Game 4 of NLDS.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game took place at Citi Field in Queens, New York.
The umpires for the game were James Hoye, Carlos Torres, Andy Fletcher, John Tumpane, Edwin Moscoso, and Doug Eddings.
